fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38745].
  {panel}

Hi there,
It would bet useful to have the ability to modify fields directly in a new gadget (like filter result).
Details : form a filter, i can show columns i want to display in the gadget ( like Filter result Gadget). And here, have the possibility to update all fields by clicking on it ( with a pencil icon). It will avoid wasting time to click on the wheel>modify>save>coming back on the filter result.
Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Modify field directly from dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38744].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create two Issue that has a Japanese character
# Try to link the issues. From the first issue:
#* Click on *More > Link* button
#* Click on *Search for an issue* link
#* Click on *Advanced search*
#* Use this for the JQL query:
{code}
text ~ "私"
{code}
_or any Japanese character_

h4. Expected result:
Issue which has that certain character will be shown

h4. Actual result:
Error message popped up saying 'Invalid JQL query'
!invalid JQL.png|thumbnail!

h4. Environment:
Only happened on Internet Explorer, using Chrome or Firefox works normally.
fields.summary: Query in Japanese language throw 'Invalid JQL query' error in Advanced Search for Issue Linking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38738].
  {panel}

Following customer comments in the OnDemand documentation, I'm raising a feature request for the ability to link a specific project to a specific Bitbucket repository for them. 
The use case would be that developers on a project can only access the repo related to that project to both minimise mistakes and make it easier to manage.
Comment links:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Linking+a+Bitbucket+or+GitHub+repository+with+JIRA+OnDemand?focusedCommentId=604537980#comment-604537980
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+linked+Bitbucket+and+GitHub+accounts?focusedCommentId=604276086#comment-604276086
fields.summary: Ability to link a JIRA project to a specific Bitbucket (or Github) repository

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38737].
  {panel}

It is very useful that "user-picker (single use)" in JIRA 6.2 supports user-filtering.  

Also, it will be nice to every customer that "user-pikcer (multi users) also support use-filtering.

I know there is "User Picker Plugin" in Marketplace, but it isn't available for JIRA 6.x.

Thank you in advance
fields.summary: Enhance "User-picker (multi users)" to support user-filter function like a "User-picker (single user)"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38735].
  {panel}

*Steps to Replicate:*

1. Create a screen with Tabs (as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Screen#DefiningaScreen-Configuringascreen'stabsandfields). 
2. Edit an issue (where the screen with tabs applies)
3. Select *Configure Fields: Custom* view and ensure that fields from both tabs are selected
4. Note that the Tabs are not displayed.
5. Switching back to *all* fields causes the Tabs to be displayed again
fields.summary: 'Configure Fields: Custom View' does not show tabs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38733].
  {panel}

There are some improvements to search performance, for example:
* https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-3653
{quote}
I've noticed that when doing thousands of searches in a single thread the average time is quite low i.e. a few milliseconds. When adding more concurrent searches doing exactly the same search the average time increases drastically. 
I've profiled the search classes and found that the whole of lucene blocks on

org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentCoreReaders.getTermsReader
org.apache.lucene.util.VirtualMethod
public synchronized int getImplementationDistance 
org.apache.lucene.util.AttributeSourcew.getAttributeInterfaces

These cause search times to increase from a few milliseconds to up to 2 seconds when doing 500 concurrent searches on the same in memory index. Note: That the index is not being updates at all, so not refresh methods are called at any stage.
{quote}

As more concurrent searches occur, performance seems to degrade due to lucene synchronization. This effects the larger instances of JIRA.
fields.summary: Upgrade Lucene to 3.6+

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38732].
  {panel}

jira.text.field.character.limit is respected for description, environment, comments.

However some add-ons could use a large custom field instead of their own database table to track things so having jira.text.field.character.limit affect custom fields by default is risky.

Propose new jira.text.field.character.limit.customfields (so it falls right next to existing) it should default to 0 as well.

Bonus: This way a jira-system-administrator can control it above a jira-administrator who may be making custom fields and not always understanding implications.

There is already a request for setting limits on a single custom field (especially at least at creation). vs Hack of of making a field a system field...
fields.summary: jira.text.field.character.limit.customfields
Add /render/ to REST API v2.0
Allow user to be able to see what will be the impact of permission changes
default configuration of jira is duplicating the logged data in catalina.out and atlassian-jira.log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38724].
  {panel}

Currently have to edit velocity templates weight (or not use the built in Description and make a new custom multi line field Descriptions)

JRA-38723 is about an easy ui for velocity view issue screen arrangement similar to the dashboard editor ui

If you place the description on screens above all other fields in your sort order it would go above details, if it's above say a custom multi line text field, that custom field would move out of details and beneath description.

Filed against JIRA 6.2.6
Painful method of editing locations  https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/48974/how-do-i-move-the-attachment-and-linked-issue-fields-above-the-description-field-in-jira-5-0-1
 <web-panel key="details-module" location="atl.jira.view.issue.left.context" weight="100">
 <web-panel key="descriptionmodule" location="atl.jira.view.issue.left.context" weight="200">

Another approach is to have the ability to move multi-line custom fields to the description area - this would enforce better usage of the built-in description (vs just hiding description)
fields.summary: Description field should respect screen sort order for issue view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38722].
{panel}
h3. *Problem*

Currently, it’s not possible to collapse/expand multi-line text fields.

On the new issue view, the multi-line is shown under the Description field, and depending on each company, it may have more than one multi-line field and it makes it hard to read everything.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the option to expand/collapse the multi-line fields, maybe a Show/Hide details the same as the Description field in Service Management projects, so users/admins can expand one field at a time to read the details.
fields.summary: Ability to expand/collapse multi-line custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38720].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# install JIRA wallboard plugin.
# got to the dashboard and click on the _Tools > View as Wallboard_.
# check the logs to find the following lines:
{code} 2014-06-12 21:58:30,345 http-bio-7625-exec-17 INFO admin 1318x143x1 vnimab 10.60.5.147 /plugins/servlet/Wallboard/ [atlassian.jirawallboard.servlet.WallboardServlet] Session id is: 0AAB676DD1908CEFC39253569A7C3593 {code}
# stop JIRA.
# Find the file in _JIRA Installation Folder > atlassian-jira > WEB-INF > classes > log4j.properties_.
# edit the file and add another logging properties inside for JIRA Wallboard plugin:
{code}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jirawallboard.servlet.WallboardServlet = WARN, console, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jirawallboard.servlet.WallboardServlet = false
{code}
# start JIRA and view the dashboard on wallboard again.

*Expected Result:*
Any logging below WARN will not be appearing on the logs.

*Actual Result:*
The INFO logs still appearing in the logs:
{code} 2014-06-12 21:58:30,345 http-bio-7625-exec-17 INFO admin 1318x143x1 vnimab 10.60.5.147 /plugins/servlet/Wallboard/ [atlassian.jirawallboard.servlet.WallboardServlet] Session id is: 0AAB676DD1908CEFC39253569A7C3593 {code}

*Note:*
* The logging will be possible to be set up only on UI (Logging and Profiling)
* After refresh, the logging level change back from WARN to ALL.
fields.summary: Unable to set logging for JIRA Wallboard Plugin permanently in log4j.properties

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38719].
  {panel}

In the group administration screen, after clicking on the group name, the message below is displayed if there are no saved filters shared with this group:
Saved Filters - "There are no Saved Filters *associated* with this Group."

!saved_filters.png!

This might lead people to believe that there are no saved filters making any reference to this group in their JQL (the word association is ambiguous in this context).
I believe the text should be changed to "There are no Saved Filters shared with this Group." to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: The text should be improved for the Saved Filters in the group administration screen.
Add webpanel to Create Issue dialog for Atlassian Connect to hook into
Mobile view's menu icon contains much different functions to the identical desktop icon for app switching.
As a JIRA Administrator I would like to be able to identify vendors in their profile so I can know if they are internal or external staff.
As an Administrator I would like to go back to being able to see group assignments for users so I don't need to open each profile to see what group they are part of
As a JIRA Administrator I want to see how many users are in each group in User Management so I can ensure security is maintained.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38703].
  {panel}

When triaging, editing or otherwise updating a ticket, I'm often faced with the problem of needing to review some details of the ticket. But the edit modal dialog fills up the entire ticket. You might be lucky to see the original submitter partly covered off to the right. its really bad experience. Makes me wonder if you use your own product.

Can you PLEASE add some way to move the modal dialog out of the way and view the details of the bug. Maybe a "collapse" button. Or maybe just a "open in new window" button.

My currnet workaround is to open a new window and browse to the bug. Yuck!

Generally you need access to any details in the bug while in one of the modal screens. This mght include:

    Description
    Reporter / Current Assignee
    Attachments
     Comments
fields.summary: Can't view issue details while editing an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38701].
  {panel}

As a person in a planning/grooming meeting
I would like to be able to bulk-add a set of sub-tasks after a story has been created
So that I can cut down the time spent creating sub-tasks

As part of our planning/grooming meetings we add sub-tasks to a story which 90% of the time are pretty similar for each story i.e. design, dev test, document. It would be nice if there was a quick create option on a story that would bring up a tick list of sub-tasks that would then get generated on the story.

I know that there are plug-ins available but they don't do exactly what I would like as it is generally during the creation process of the item.
fields.summary: Quick Create Story With Pre-defined Sub-tasks

Ubuntu 14.04 with Unity, theme Ambient Dark. Firefox.
The forms (such as the "Create Issue" form I am writing in right now) use system color for the text field backgrounds, but forces black as foreground color.

Either:
- use system colors for everything, both foreground and background (preferred), or
- force colors for both foreground and background.

See attached screenshot.
Similar to this old issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12808?jql=text%20~%20%22dark%20background%22 (I couldn't reopen it)
fields.summary: Unreadable forms in dark system colors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38662].
  {panel}

After did some further investigation in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-193355 support request, it seem  our [Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-Createanewissueoraddacommenttoanexistingissue] article information is not complete.

Perhaps, we can include the following details:

{quote}
An email is classified as 'bulk' if any of the following is true:
* The first 'Precedence' header in the message is 'bulk'
* The message is a "multipart/report" message and the content type contains 'report-type=delivery-status'
* The message is not a "multipart/report" message and the "Return-Path" is "<>"
* The message contains the header "Auto-Submitted" with a value different than "no"

If an email is 'bulk', there are three possible actions:
* The mail is ignored, the debug log should have the line "Ignoring email with bulk delivery type", adds the log line 'Rejecting message due to failed bulk check.' and the issue/comment *is not* created.
* The mail is forwarded, the debug log should have the line "Forwarding email with bulk delivery type", adds the log line 'Rejecting message due to failed bulk check.' and the issue/comment *is not* created.
* The mail is deleted, the debug log should have the line "Deleting email with bulk delivery type", adds the log line 'Rejecting message due to failed bulk check.' and the issue/comment *is not* created.

If the email is 'bulk' but the MailHandler does not have a valid config for 'bulk=', it will be processed as any regular (i.e. non bulk) mail. Note: this assumption needs to be tested, the MailHandler might set a default 'bulk' value) 
{quote}

We think the doc need to add more information, as in it does not include the "multipart/report" cases, it does not mention that *not* configuring "bulk" will include those emails in the regular process (see note above) and does not makes it clear enough that configuring 'bulk' means those bulk emails will not create issues/comments.
fields.summary: Update Mail Handler Documentation
Ability to set View option as Default of Issue Navigator
Allow use of Category for ordering in JQL
add feedback page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38653].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian,

We were very upset to find out that after deleting a very large issue by accident we were unable to restore it.  All solutions provided on the forums were workarounds and that Jira itself was not designed to support "soft deletes". 

We feel that ticket information is very important.  Not only you lose the ticket and its history but also every work log entries of time tracking.  Since the data really belongs to us, the customer, we feel this is unacceptable.

We would appreciate if the Jira team corrects this design flaw and not closes it as done with similar issue: JRA-21831.

Thanks in advance,
Customer
fields.summary: Jira Soft Deletes of Issues

When using French as the language in JIRA, the 'Attach Screenshot' link is cut by server in a middle of ""e;" entity, showing an ugly "&..." at the end of the line :

!attach screenshot2.png|thumbnail!

Some further inspection into the HTML shows that even within the class, it is showing wrongly :

!add screenshot.png|thumbnail!

The ellipsis mechanism should take care to HTML entity to prevent such cut.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38629].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

When the user generates a support.zip file, he has to browse through the folder in order to get the file.

h3. Expected behaviour

It would be great to have a support.zip download link after generating the file.

Some users are JIRA administrators, but have no access to the JIRA server itself, which can make the troubleshooting process longer for support tickets.
fields.summary: Download link for support.zip after generation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38628].
  {panel}

Currently, when default values of custom fields are mapped according to certain projects or issues types, then when those are changed, the default value does not change, and remains the original value.

An example :

# Given 2 projects in JIRA, A and B
# There is a 'Number' custom field
# For this 'Number' custom field, if an issue is created in A, the default value would be '12345'. If it is created in B, the default value would be '2468'. 
# When a user creates an issue, he/she first chooses A (within the create issue form). The 'Number' field is understandably set to 12345 by default. However, if the user was to change the project to B instead, the value would not change to 2468, but remain with 12345

It would be much more convenient if the default values can keep track of any changes performed, so that the value would be updated automatically
fields.summary: Default values of custom fields should change dynamically

h4. *Current Feature*
Projects listed in *Administration > Projects*  includes Name, Key, URL, Project Lead, Default Assignee, and Operations.

h4. *Request Description*
Projects listed in the *Administration > Projects* should also state the date and time the project was last edited derived from last activities in the projects. (i.e comments, issue assigned etc. ). This helps in determining active projects in the instance.

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38607].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

When we have a lot of projects, some of the projects becomes obsolete and are no longer necessary. We can't delete the project as it would delete the issues and we would loose historical data by moving the issues to another project.

h3. Expected behaviour

Create the option to convert a project into a component of another project, so all the issues will keep the historical data but without having to keep the project.
fields.summary: Ability to convert a project into a component of another project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38602].
  {panel}

Please add timeZone information of author (and may be updateAuthor) of each worklog for search endpoint, similarly to user endpoint.

E.g. http://localhost:2990/jira/rest/api/2/search?fields=*all returns:
{code}
        "worklog" : { "maxResults" : 2,
            "startAt" : 0,
            "total" : 2,
            "worklogs" : [ { "author" : { "active" : true,
                      "avatarUrls" : { "16x16" : "http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/useravatar?size=small&avatarId=10122",
                          "48x48" : "http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/useravatar?avatarId=10122"
                        },
                      "displayName" : "admin",
                      "emailAddress" : "admin@example.com",
                      "name" : "admin",
                      "self" : "http://localhost:2990/jira/rest/api/2/user?username=admin"
                    },
{code}

And http://localhost:2990/jira/rest/api/2/user?username=admin returns:
{code}
   "displayName":"admin",
   "active":true,
   "timeZone":"Europe/Dublin",
{code}

The timeZone info is missing in expanded worklog.

Thank you.
fields.summary: REST: Add timeZone to worklog.author for sarch endpoint
No WorkBox notifications in JIRA?
Allow to store arbitrary data associated to users (i.e. user properties)
Provide access to public filter through REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38598].
  {panel}

We have a big JIRA instance on a really good hardware:
* ~300k issues
* 48GB RAM
* 32 cores
* SSD in RAID
* PostgreSQL on localhsot

Still, reindexing does not increase the load above 4-5 (out of 32!), database is not under high load nor the filesystem.

Clearly this means that indexing is not properly using the resources in order to index rapidly.

Even with this configuration, a foreground reindex takes about one hour which is too much for a live system, in fact is too much even for a background reindex.

{code}
top - 11:57:30 up 50 days, 21:35,  2 users,  load average: 4.43, 4.02, 3.79
Tasks: 413 total,   3 running, 410 sleeping,   0 stopped,   0 zombie
Cpu(s): 14.3%us,  0.6%sy,  0.0%ni, 84.8%id,  0.1%wa,  0.0%hi,  0.1%si,  0.0%st

fields.summary: JIRA reindexing is too slow - doesn't use existing CPUs
The ability to Modify the Reporter and also being the reporter of a cloned issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38595].
  {panel}

There are currently 2 types of RSS feeds:
- the activity stream on a project that provides all changes on issues of the project
- the filter RSS feed (issue/comments) that provides all new issues that fits the filter query

But there is no "activity stream" RSS feed based on a filter (that would provide all changes made to issues that are in the filter).
This is something that would really be usefull for people who don't like receiving many email notifications.
fields.summary: RSS Activity stream on filter
JIRA email handlers shouldn't process emails with the DELETED flag set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38593].
  {panel}

*Title*

The title of the modal dialog says _The status 'x' cannot be removed._

This is inconsistent with the ADG, which states titles in modal dialog should not have full stops at the end, and the writing style says to use contractions. So it should be:

_The status 'x' can't be removed_

*Message content*

The message says _Statuses cannot be removed from draft workflows._

This doesn't describe the problem or tell me how to fix it. It also doesn't fit with our "friendly, yet concise" tone and certainly isn't human sounding. Perhaps something better:

_Statuses can't be removed from workflows that are in use. It's possible that an issue is using the status you're trying to delete. In order to delete this status you might need to migrate any issues to a new status._

_More information on configuring workflow (link)_

* https://developer.atlassian.com/design/1.4/foundations/language/
* https://developer.atlassian.com/design/1.4/components/modal-dialog/
fields.summary: The messaging for when I can't remove a status from the workflow editor is not helpful

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38592].
  {panel}

Due to the power outage my local cookie cache got corrupted. Chrome still had the xsrf token cookie, but the value was empty.

fields.summary: Empty xsrf token makes JIRA throw exceptions
I cannot assign an issue to an user, but I can mention him

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38588].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

* create two users; user1 and user2
* grant user1 permission to create issues in a test project and don't grant user2 that permission
* try creating an issue with a third user (let's say admin, and grant this user the *Modify Reporter* permission)
* start typing user in the reporter field: both users will be displayed)

I understand there's a field called "Creator" now in JIRA that is separated from the Reporter field, however, since the Creator field is not shown on the screen, the reporter field is considered the creator of the issue and it should show only users that are granted the *Create Issues* permission.
fields.summary: Users without Create Issues permission are listed is the reporter field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38587].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

Currently the process to migrate from JIRA OnDemand to JIRA standalone it's a complex process which could be made easier. You have to request a backup to the OnDemand team and wait for the correct versions of the plugin for being compatible (like JIRA Agile for example when we have a new release).

h3. Expected behaviour

An option could be created in the "Restore System" section from JIRA's Administration to "Import from OnDemand", where you would place the OnDemand URL and login with your credentials to do a direct import without having to touch the data.
fields.summary: Suggestion to improve the migration between JIRA OD and standalone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38585].
  {panel}

It is possible in Create/Edit/... screens to define a custom view of the displayed fields. 
This feature is nice but the configuration is only applicable to the current user.
All our projects share the same custom field scheme; but for some of these projects, the users do not need to display all the fields.
As we do not want to create a specific field scheme for these projects (due to maintenance overhead reasons), it would be nice if a user could export his own "Configure fields" settings. And to load a settings from another user (so it can be shared amongst people of the same project).
fields.summary: Allow export/import of user's "Configure fields" screen settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38580].
  {panel}

I frequently interact with a colleague "Carl".
When I'm trying to add him as a watcher by typing [ Carl ], the first suggestion in the drop down menu is always for another person "Carla".

I've never interacted with Carla.
I've never chosen that name from the search results when I searched for [ Carl ].

Since I'm performing a filter/search already, I don't mind if the search results get sorted by frequency rather than alphabetically.

Suggestion:
When filtering by a search term, it would improve the user experience if all the user-suggestion lists were sorted by search result usage.

Measuring usage by "how often the searcher has chosen a search-result, either tracked by search term, or globally", and hopefully separate usage by field.

Unclear bits:
If I often Assign tasks to "Walt", that *must* influence the suggestions for an Assign field, but it's not clear if this should extend to other fields, for example, the Watchers field.
fields.summary: Sort user search results based on frequency of use {watchers, assignees, etc}
Bad links in Projects Gadget
Should be able to specify service name during unattended install
"View Source" on comments
Option to configure the Sub-Tasks summary list columns
Allow setting the creation/update date of an issue when creating them via the REST api
Bulk operation for Road Map is missing
Issue status styling (color, css) inconsistent across JIRA
What's New Dialog points at wrong version when manually triggered in OnDemand
JIRA data anonymiser destroys history changes for fields such as Story Points and SLAs that are needed to repro cases
Don't obscure main issue while creating subtasks
Group list with expand=users should provide user key
Have the Affect Version/s Field Render a Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38553].
  {panel}

Currently if you sort the issue navigator by components, it only sorts based on the first component, but not the others. For example, let's say we have the following components: A, B, C, D, E.
The expected sort order of the issues with the following components in the issue navigator should be:
A
A, B
A, B, C
A, B, C, D
B, C
B, C
B, C, D
B, C, D
B, C, D, E

But in reality, JIRA sorts only by the first component and everything jumbles up: [^Sort.jpg]
fields.summary: Sorting by Component in issue navigator should take into account all components instead of only first component
Linked Issues field on custom screen cannot link to external JIRA issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38549].
  {panel}

***Current Behaviour***
Commits are displayed in the Development panel only. 

***Suggestion***
The activity stream gadget should include the commits for an issue.
fields.summary: Activity Stream Gadget should Display Commits in the Issues
The Create Issue form for Jira, which I am typing into, does not have a Priority field
The page where you come to enter Jira bugs is headed "Welcome to the Confluence Project"
Change Assignee
